Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery bell-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of satyr and maenad: part of lower torso, thighs and tail of satyr with fawn-skin hanging behind him, to right; at right, part of peplos of meanad bending forward to right and probably resting her left foot on raised ground.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd joins Oxford AN1896-1908-G.737 (1), which gives some of the upper part of both figures. The sherd may belong to same vase as Oxford AN1896-1908-G.738.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0214) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p.124, pl. LXVII, no. 13)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
